Warm-Up.title: March in Place
Warm-Up.description: A low-impact exercise that helps warm up the body and improve flexibility, allowing for greater ease of movement and reducing the risk of injury during more intense workouts.
Warm-Up.instructions: March in place, lifting your knees and pumping your arms.
Warm-Up.common_mistakes: Avoid overstriding. Keep your pace light and steady.

Warm-Up.title: Jumping Jacks
Warm-Up.description: A classic cardio exercise that boosts your heart rate and improves cardiovascular fitness, ensuring enhanced blood flow and stamina during physical activities.
Warm-Up.instructions: Stand with feet together and arms at your sides. Jump while spreading your legs and raising your arms. Return to starting position and repeat.
Warm-Up.common_mistakes: Don't slouch. Keep your posture straight. Avoid jerky movements. Ensure a smooth jump and landing.

Warm-Up.title: Mountain Climbers
Warm-Up.description: Mountain Climbers engage core muscles, promoting better movement and range of motion, enhancing overall physical endurance and stamina.
Warm-Up.instructions: Start in a plank position. Quickly alternate bringing one knee towards your chest and then the other, keeping your core tight throughout.
Warm-Up.common_mistakes: Avoid letting your hips drop or rise. Maintain a straight body line.

Warm-Up.title: Pelvic Floor Squeeze
Warm-Up.description: An exercise focusing on contracting and relaxing the pelvic floor muscles to improve stability and control, which supports overall physical health and stamina.
Warm-Up.instructions: Contract your pelvic floor muscles, hold for a few seconds, then release. Repeat the contraction and release.
Warm-Up.common_mistakes: Avoid tensing the abdominal muscles. Focus on the pelvic area.

Warm-Up.title: Lateral Lunges
Warm-Up.description: Lateral Lunges engage the leg and pelvic muscles, contributing to better endurance and flexibility, which can support longer-lasting performance.
Warm-Up.instructions: Step out to the side with one leg and lower your hips, keeping the other leg straight. Push off with the bent leg to return to the starting position. Repeat on the other side.
Warm-Up.common_mistakes: Avoid letting your knee extend past your toes. Maintain a controlled motion and keep the torso upright.

Warm-Up.title: Pelvic Tilts
Warm-Up.description: Pelvic Tilts target the pelvic region and lower back, improving blood circulation and muscle engagement, contributing to overall fitness and function.
Warm-Up.instructions: Lie on your back with knees bent. Flatten your back against the floor by tilting your pelvis upwards, then relax.
Warm-Up.common_mistakes: Avoid arching your back. Keep movements slow and controlled.

Warm-Up.title: Hold and Release Kegel
Warm-Up.description: Hold and Release Kegel exercises improve pelvic floor strength, aiding in overall endurance and performance by providing better control and stability.
Warm-Up.instructions: Sit or lie down comfortably. Tighten the muscles you'd use to stop urination. Hold and release.
Warm-Up.common_mistakes: Avoid using your stomach or leg muscles. Focus on pelvic muscles only.

Warm-Up.title: Romanian Deadlifts Right
Warm-Up.description: This balance-based exercise strengthens the hamstrings and pelvic floor, supporting better blood flow and muscle control for overall fitness.
Warm-Up.instructions: Stand on one leg, hinge at the hips and lower your torso while extending the other leg back. Return to start and switch legs.
Warm-Up.common_mistakes: Avoid rounding your back. Keep your movements controlled.

Warm-Up.title: Romanian Deadlifts Left
Warm-Up.description: This balance-based exercise strengthens the hamstrings and pelvic floor, supporting better blood flow and muscle control for overall fitness.
Warm-Up.instructions: Stand on one leg, hinge at the hips and lower your torso while extending the other leg back. Return to start and switch legs.
Warm-Up.common_mistakes: Avoid rounding your back. Keep your movements controlled.

Warm-Up.title: Standing Toe Touch
Warm-Up.description: The Standing Toe Touch improves flexibility in the hamstrings and lower back, which can help improve posture and stamina during physical activities.
Warm-Up.instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart and bend forward at the hips to touch your toes. Hold the stretch without bouncing.
Warm-Up.common_mistakes: Avoid rounding your back. Keep your knees slightly bent.

Main Workout.title: Prone Pelvic Rotations
Main Workout.description: A low-impact exercise that improves flexibility and strengthens the lower back and core, focusing on pelvic stability. This exercise helps warm up the body and enhances mobility, reducing the risk of injury during more intense workouts.
Main Workout.instructions: Rotate your lower back, pelvis, and glutes in a circle. Complete one circle, then switch directions.
Main Workout.common_mistakes: Avoid arching your lower back excessively. Keep your core engaged throughout the movement, and perform the rotations slowly to maintain control and prevent strain.

Main Workout.title: Pelvic Side Press
Main Workout.description: A low-impact exercise that strengthens the lower back and core while improving pelvic stability. This exercise mimics controlled pelvic movements, enhancing coordination and flexibility, often used for improving mobility in the pelvic region.
Main Workout.instructions: Press one side of your lower back toward the ground, alternating sides. Engage your pelvic muscles with each press.
Main Workout.common_mistakes: Avoid pushing too forcefully, as this can strain the lower back. Maintain control by engaging your core muscles and move slowly. Keep your torso stable to isolate the pelvic movement.

Main Workout.title: Prone Pelvic Thrust
Main Workout.description: A low-impact exercise that strengthens the lower back, core, and pelvic muscles, focusing on controlled thrusting movements. This exercise improves pelvic mobility, stability, and coordination, simulating a forward thrust while maintaining proper form.
Main Workout.instructions: Engage your core and glutes. Thrust your pelvis down, keeping legs straight and back flat.
Main Workout.common_mistakes: Avoid bending your knees or arching your lower back excessively. Keep the movement controlled to engage the pelvic muscles properly and prevent lower back strain. Ensure that the motion comes from the hips and pelvis, not the upper body.

Main Workout.title: Thrust Jumps
Main Workout.description: A dynamic exercise that strengthens the lower back, core, and pelvic muscles, combining a thrusting motion with a jumping movement to increase intensity. This exercise improves pelvic stability, coordination, and flexibility, while engaging the entire lower body and core.
Main Workout.instructions: Thrust your pelvis, then jump your feet to your hands to form a V-shape. Keep hands still. Return, and repeat.
Main Workout.common_mistakes: Avoid letting your hips sag during the thrust or arching your lower back. Ensure that your jump is controlled, and avoid using momentum from your upper body. Keep your core engaged throughout the movement to protect your lower back and improve form.

Main Workout.title: Pelvic Attack
Main Workout.description: An intense exercise that strengthens the core, lower back, and pelvic muscles, mimicking thrusting motions. This exercise focuses on pelvic stability, improving coordination, mobility, and endurance in the lower body while engaging the core for support.
Main Workout.instructions: Raise upper body. Engage your core and glutes. Perform controlled hip thrusts, moving your hips forward and back.
Main Workout.common_mistakes: Avoid letting your hips sag or raising your body too high during the thrust. Keep your core engaged to maintain stability and prevent lower back strain. Ensure that the motion remains controlled and does not rely on momentum.

Main Workout.title: Vertical Hip Swing
Main Workout.description: A dynamic movement exercise designed to enhance core strength, improve flexibility, and promote lower body stability. This exercise engages the pelvic region while improving coordination and endurance.
Main Workout.instructions: Swing your hips upward and downward in a controlled motion, keeping your upper body stable.
Main Workout.common_mistakes: Avoid letting your hips collapse during the downward swing or using excessive force. Maintain control and fluidity in the movement, engaging your core to prevent strain. Ensure the movement is powered by the hips and pelvis.

Main Workout.title: Sky Thrust
Main Workout.description: An exercise aimed at enhancing pelvic mobility and lower body stability. It combines thrusting motions with a reverse tabletop pose to improve flexibility and overall core strength.
Main Workout.instructions: Thrust your hips upwards while maintaining a stable tabletop position. Keep hands and feet grounded.
Main Workout.common_mistakes: Avoid arching your lower back excessively during the thrust. Engage your core and maintain control throughout the movement, ensuring smooth, deliberate thrusts. Do not rely on momentum.

Main Workout.title: Advanced Bridges
Main Workout.description: A core strengthening exercise that also works the glutes and lower back, performed through a controlled thrusting motion. This exercise helps improve hip flexibility and overall pelvic stability.
Main Workout.instructions: Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat. Lift your hips into a straight line from your shoulders to your knees, then lower back down.
Main Workout.common_mistakes: Avoid overextending your lower back at the top of the movement. Keep your core engaged to avoid arching your back. Ensure your knees stay aligned with your hips to avoid strain, and avoid using momentum.

Main Workout.title: Back Burden
Main Workout.description: An energetic movement exercise targeting the core and lower body, focusing on rapid thrusting motions to improve stability and mobility.
Main Workout.instructions: Lie face down with knees slightly elevated off the ground. Thrust your pelvis forward in quick, controlled motions, keeping your knees bent and toes touching the floor.
Main Workout.common_mistakes: Avoid using excessive force or arching your back during the thrust. Keep the movement controlled and swift, powered by your core and pelvic muscles, without using momentum from the torso.

Main Workout.title: Rotating Back Burden
Main Workout.description: An advanced pelvic stability exercise that strengthens the core, lower back, and glutes through rotational thrusting movements. This exercise emphasizes pelvic control and mobility while engaging the muscles of the lower body and core to improve stability and coordination.
Main Workout.instructions: Engage your core and glutes. Rotate your hips side to side while thrusting backward in smooth, controlled circles.
Main Workout.common_mistakes: Avoid excessive twisting of the lower back, as this can cause strain. Keep the motion controlled and avoid relying on momentum from your upper body. Focus on engaging your core and glutes to power the movement and ensure that the rotation remains steady and does not compromise your form.

Main Workout.title: Slanted Hip Thrust
Main Workout.description: A pelvic stability exercise that strengthens the core, lower back, and glutes through controlled, angled thrusting motions. This exercise focuses on pelvic control, stability, and mobility, engaging the lower body and core while maintaining stability in a slanted position.
Main Workout.instructions: Start on the ground with your elbows, palms, and knees down. Engage your core and glutes, then thrust your hips forward and back. Keep your upper body stable and your legs bent.
Main Workout.common_mistakes: Avoid arching your lower back too much or letting your hips dip too low. Keep the movement controlled, powered by your pelvic muscles, and avoid using momentum from your upper body. Focus on engaging your core to maintain stability and prevent strain on your lower back.

Main Workout.title: V-Thrust
Main Workout.description: An advanced pelvic stability exercise that engages the core, lower back, and glutes through rotational thrusting movements. This variation incorporates a V-shaped leg position to enhance pelvic control, mobility, and stability, strengthening the entire lower body.
Main Workout.instructions: Start on the floor with your fists together and legs in a V shape. Thrust your pelvis downward while rotating your lower back.
Main Workout.common_mistakes: Avoid overextending or twisting your lower back excessively during the thrusts. Keep the movement controlled and steady, ensuring you don't rely on momentum from your upper body. Maintain engagement of your core to prevent strain and support the stability of your lower back throughout the exercise.

Main Workout.title: Deep V-Thrusts
Main Workout.description: A focused stability exercise that strengthens the core, glutes, and lower back through controlled thrusting motions. This variation features both knees and toes in contact with the ground, enhancing stability while engaging the entire lower body.
Main Workout.instructions: Kneel with elbows and palms on the ground. Knees and toes planted. Thrust your pelvis downward smoothly. Keep your upper body stable with legs wide.
Main Workout.common_mistakes: Avoid excessive arching of your lower back during the thrusts. Maintain a controlled motion, ensuring you do not rely on momentum from your upper body. Keep your core engaged to prevent strain and support stability throughout the exercise.

Main Workout.title: Supine Leg Raise
Main Workout.description: This core-strengthening exercise targets the lower abdominal muscles, enhancing core stability and promoting overall strength, which supports improved posture and body control.
Main Workout.instructions: Lie on your back with legs extended. Lift your legs to a 90-degree angle, then lower them slowly without touching the ground.
Main Workout.common_mistakes: Avoid arching your lower back. Keep your legs straight and controlled.

Main Workout.title: Plank
Main Workout.description: The Plank strengthens the core muscles, improving posture, stability, and endurance, contributing to better overall strength and control during various physical activities.
Main Workout.instructions: Lie face down. Lift your body onto your toes and forearms. Keep your body in a straight line from head to heels.
Main Workout.common_mistakes: Don't let your hips sag. Keep your body in a straight line and engage your core.

Main Workout.title: Glute Bridges
Main Workout.description: Glute Bridges target the glutes and pelvic floor muscles, enhancing pelvic stability and control, supporting better overall physical performance and endurance.
Main Workout.instructions: Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor. Lift your hips towards the ceiling, then lower back down.
Main Workout.common_mistakes: Avoid arching your lower back. Keep movements controlled.

Main Workout.title: Hip Thrusts
Main Workout.description: Hip Thrusts strengthen the glutes, hips, and pelvic floor muscles, promoting better overall strength and control during physical activities.
Main Workout.instructions: Sit on the ground with your upper back resting on a bench. Roll a barbell or weight over your hips. Push your hips upward and squeeze your glutes at the top.
Main Workout.common_mistakes: Avoid arching your lower back. Keep the movement controlled.

Main Workout.title: Sumo Squat
Main Workout.description: Sumo Squats enhance leg and pelvic strength, promoting overall physical fitness and well-being.
Main Workout.instructions: Stand with feet wider than shoulder-width apart and toes pointed outward. Lower your hips back and down, keeping your knees aligned with your toes. Return to standing position.
Main Workout.common_mistakes: Avoid letting knees cave in. Keep your back straight and chest up.

Main Workout.title: Romanian Deadlifts Right
Main Workout.description: This exercise strengthens the hamstrings and supports overall balance and flexibility, contributing to improved physical performance.
Main Workout.instructions: Stand on one leg, hinge at the hips and lower your torso while extending the other leg back. Return to start and switch legs.
Main Workout.common_mistakes: Avoid rounding your back. Keep your movements controlled.

Main Workout.title: Frog Thrusts
Main Workout.description: This dynamic exercise enhances pelvic mobility, stability, and core engagement, strengthening the lower body and promoting flexibility.
Main Workout.instructions: Start in a frog position with palms flat and knees touching the ground. Spread your legs wide. Engage your core and thrust your hips rhythmically. Keep your upper body stable.
Main Workout.common_mistakes: Avoid using excessive force or letting your lower back arch too much during the thrusts. Maintain control throughout the motion, and ensure your core is engaged to support your lower back and prevent strain.

Main Workout.title: Standing Toe Touch
Main Workout.description: The Standing Toe Touch improves flexibility in the hamstrings and lower back, helping with posture and overall mobility.
Main Workout.instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart and bend forward at the hips to touch your toes. Hold the stretch without bouncing.
Main Workout.common_mistakes: Avoid rounding your back. Keep your knees slightly bent.

Main Workout.title: Butterfly Hip Thrusts
Main Workout.description: Butterfly Hip Thrusts target the glutes and pelvic floor, promoting muscle strength and control, supporting overall stamina and endurance.
Main Workout.instructions: Lie down in butterfly pose. Thrust your hips upward, squeezing your glutes. Lower back down.
Main Workout.common_mistakes: Avoid arching your lower back excessively. Focus on using your glutes and core to lift your hips.

Cooldown.title: Standing Quad Stretch Right
Cooldown.description: A stretch focusing on the quadriceps and hips, enhancing flexibility and reducing muscle tension.
Cooldown.instructions: Stand on one leg. Pull the other foot towards your butt with your hand. Keep your knees together. Hold for 10 seconds. Switch legs.
Cooldown.common_mistakes: Don't arch your back. Keep knees together. Stretch gently, no pain. Hold onto something if you're wobbly.

Cooldown.title: Cobra Pose
Cooldown.description: The Cobra Pose opens the chest and stretches the abdomen, promoting relaxation and reducing tension in the body, which helps in releasing stress after physical activity.
Cooldown.instructions: Lie face down, push up with your hands, arching your back and stretching your chest.
Cooldown.common_mistakes: Don't overextend. keep hips on the ground.

Cooldown.title: Child's Pose
Cooldown.description: This calming yoga posture helps release tension in the lower back and hips, promoting relaxation and reducing stress after intense physical activities.
Cooldown.instructions: Kneel on the floor with toes touching and knees apart. Sit back on your heels and extend your arms forward. Rest your forehead on the floor and breathe deeply. Hold for 20 seconds.
Cooldown.common_mistakes: Don't force your forehead to the ground. Keep your arms extended and relaxed. Avoid tensing your shoulders.

Cooldown.title: Diaphragmatic Breathing
Cooldown.description: This breathing exercise focuses on deep, controlled breaths, which help reduce anxiety, lower stress levels, and improve mental clarity after a workout.
Cooldown.instructions: Sit or lie down comfortably. Inhale deeply through the nose, hold briefly, and exhale slowly through the mouth.
Cooldown.common_mistakes: Avoid shallow breathing. focus on deep, slow breaths.

Cooldown.title: Spinal Twists
Cooldown.description: Spinal Twists relieve tension in the back and shoulders, promoting relaxation and releasing stress after a workout or long day, supporting overall well-being.
Cooldown.instructions: Lie on your back with arms extended out to the sides. Bend one knee and bring it across your body towards the opposite side. Keep your shoulders on the ground and hold for 20 seconds per side.
Cooldown.common_mistakes: Avoid lifting your shoulders off the ground. keep movements slow and controlled to avoid strain.

Cooldown.title: Standing Toe Touches
Cooldown.description: A stretch that focuses on improving flexibility in the hamstrings and lower back, enhancing overall range of motion and reducing muscle tightness.
Cooldown.instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart. Reach down towards your toes, keeping your legs straight. Hold for 10 seconds, then slowly return to the starting position.
Cooldown.common_mistakes: Avoid bouncing. reach down slowly and maintain a straight back.

Cooldown.title: Chair Pose
Cooldown.description: The Chair Pose engages the lower body and core, promoting muscle growth and overall physical strength.
Cooldown.instructions: Stand with feet together, bend your knees and lower your hips as if sitting in a chair. Hold the position with your arms extended overhead.
Cooldown.common_mistakes: Avoid letting your knees cave inward. keep your weight in your heels.

Cooldown.title: Cat-Cow Pose
Cooldown.description: This gentle yoga pose helps reduce stress by improving flexibility in the spine and promoting relaxation. It's ideal for reducing tension and promoting mental focus after a workout.
Cooldown.instructions: Start on hands and knees in tabletop position. Inhale, arch your back (Cow Pose). Exhale, round your back (Cat Pose). Repeat 12 times, coordinating with your breath.
Cooldown.common_mistakes: Don't rush. move slowly and with control. Avoid straining your neck. keep it relaxed. Keep your movements fluid, not jerky. Focus on deep breathing for better results.

Cooldown.title: Hold and Release Kegel
Cooldown.description: Pelvic floor exercises improve core strength and endurance, contributing to overall health and physical performance.
Cooldown.instructions: Sit or lie down comfortably. Tighten the muscles you'd use to stop urination. Hold and release.
Cooldown.common_mistakes: Avoid using your stomach or leg muscles. Focus on pelvic muscles only.
